Name: Inglourious Basterds
Review:
the first half has all of the long drawn out wanky scenes typical of a Quentin movie, interspaced with fun short scenes.  the second? fast-paced action and tension that is darkly funny and mildly rewarding.

all favour gained with the bastards was lost as the only 2 female characters are killed. I don't care because they're women, this is a movie where almost everyone dies, and you're meant to feel sad, that some of the good guys lost. Quentin typically has a good grasp on character motivation, but then has Shoshana die because she felt sympathy? for the man who was seconds away from assaulting her.  The actress dies in a brutal and lingering shot of her being strangled, the most drawn-out death of the movie.

Why was it as brutal and long as it was? at a point where the audience already understands the evil of the nazi, and knew her fate the second he started talking to the group in the lobby... it was unnecessary, aside from the fetishization of women's pain. 

If Quentin simply didn't bother to write women, I feel this movie would have been better off

Name: I Care a Lot
Review: What a brilliant movie, with a perfect, continuous,  building of tension. I feared this woman, i respected her, i wanted her above all to not get away with her crimes, and was enthralled to see who would win. the first 90 minutes of this movie are phenomenal, so i imagine they simply spent all their efforts on that, as the ending of this movie felt flaccid, like someone else finished the movie after reading a synopsis of what had been done so far..

Name: The Brothers Grimm
Review:
When I was 3 years old my father had to babysit me but thought that would be boring. so he rented 3 movies, mars attacks, something animated, and this movie. 

He let me watch it in full, making it my first horror movie and also making it the source of nightmares for me for 12 years.

I would tell my parents that I felt like the dreams came from a movie and my Father Gaslit  Me for 12 Years that it was ALL in my head

So glad I was able to search up the right buzzwords to find this abomination. will try not to show it to any children...

Name: Love, Death & Robots: Jibaro
Review:
what a beautiful rape analogy,,, that frames it's stand-in for woman as a tantalising object that man cannot resist tearing apart.

Rape stories are one of those things, wherein, someone involved in the writing process should possibly be part of the affected group. Rather than a bunch of men who made something visually interesting, and fundamentally flawed.

This movie made me look at that feeling very directly, and remember how important it is to hold onto your positive memories even if they‚Äôre a water drop of light in a pool of shit

Name: Babylon
Review:
am disappointed but not surprised that people who rate this film low, as far as I could see, only discussed how much of a waste of time/ pointless jack off to a by-gone era (once upon a time-core), and I didn't see any that were critical of the sexist themes? feels weird.
anyway,, 

You ever think about the Greek myth of Pandora? 

The idea goes, to punish mankind for tricking him, Zeus has the whole pantheon help out to create Pandora, she of the gifts. Pandora is given beauty, grace and then Hermes is commanded  "to put in her the mind of a bitch and the character of a thief. "

and when he was finished creating her "Amazement took hold of the immortal gods and mortals as they saw the sheer trick, from 
which human beings could not escape. For from her is the race of the female sex, the ruinous tribes of women, a great affliction, who live with mortal men" 

or in Christian terms, do you ever think about Eve?

This movie kept reminding me of how and where men put the blame for the problems in life, encapsulated in Nellie's rise and fall and lack of a real character. The fact that she got more 2 dimensional the longer the film went on is quite incredible.

I'm a fan of good comedy, the first half? I guess? this film is a solid 4/4.5 for me.. lesbians are always a good thing to chuck in.  If you, I don't know, try to care about showing a lesbian romance on screen in your 3-HOUR LONG FILM?? Maybe take your jerk-off youtube compilation "History Of Film in 5 Minutes!!" out of the ending and care about your female characters more.

my thoughts are so messy with this film, and I'm so sick of seeing beautiful women through a male lens. I'm tired of a lack of sympathy,  I want more,  and every woman that gets affected by men perpetuating myths of how 'psycho' their ex is contributing to this false narrative taken in the form of a red pill.

Name: Oppenheimer
Review:
I still loved this movie, it‚Äôs stunning, there‚Äôs constant tension, the overlaying visuals of space over Oppenheimer were so pretty, and the texture and immersion in the point of time was Lovely, but Nolan,,, broski,,, Just because things are pretty doesn‚Äôt mean you get to be a jerk off!

The triple foreshadowing for New Mexico being where they were going to do the Manhattan project was nauseating.¬†
And in your biopic including the line ‚ÄúIs anyone ever going to tell the truth about what‚Äôs happening here?‚Äù is,, i don‚Äôt know,,, do you think it‚Äôs a bit on the nose?

And why did this feel like one long trailer, there‚Äôs a version of this with longer scenes but fewer of them that feels less like tiktok and gets 4.5, there‚Äôs another where Nolan learns how to write women that gets 5. The shortness of everything made a lot of line delivery just feel like they were trying to summarise Oppy facts and entire conversations as succinctly and inhumanely as possible.
